Question: Is development time boxed to 1 week - 1 month iterations?
Do sprints start with a Sprint Planning session?
Does the team have daily stand-ups?
Do sprints finish with a Sprint Review session?
Is the team stable?
Is each team < 10 people (excluding PO/SM roles)?
Is the team cross functional (i.e. do they have all skills necessary to deliver)?
Does the team understand Agile Manifesto and Values.
Have architectural principles been established?
Is there an architecture roadmap?

Does the architecture roadmap cover:
- Technical debt
- Break-up of monolithic systems and databases
- Focus on areas of business differentiation
- Mitigation of risk (e.g. vendor lock-in)
- Technical SPOFs
- Loosely coupled integration
- Clean and enforced system interfaces
Is there a technical debt log and is it maintained?
Notes: There is a tech debt log in JIRA but is not maintained at the moment asthe team are cruising to hit MVP

Question: Is there a technical decision log and is it maintained?
Are major technology decisions made with architecture input up-front and according to the architecture principles?
Is there a technology radar used to guide technology decisions towards strategic choices (in, out, investigate)?
Is there an application register listing all deployable components?
Does each component have a clear owner, and is that owner a (virtual) team (not an individual)?
Is there a risk mitigation strategy in place for out-of-support technologies?
Are there documentation standards, templates or guides setting out minimum expected documentation?
Do systems have adequate technical documentation (architecture, design, data flow etc.) to support reviews and ongoing maintenance?
Is all system documentation held in a common tool?
Have Single Points of Knowledge been mitigated?
Are major systems isolated with clean, abstract interfaces so that they can be developed and tested independently?
Are data domains bounded to system responsibilities (i.e. databases/data not shared by multiple systems)?
Is deployment an atomic process?
Are application deployment scripts automated?
Are application rollback scripts automated?
Is there a documented Environment Strategy?
Is the Environment Strategy applied - with clear ownership and responsibilities for all environments?
Can environments be reliably created/destroyed following documented manual instructions?
Have teams been trained on infrastructure as code?
Have teams been trained on selected cloud provider(s)?
Is Production access controlled and limited to essential users only?
Are evironments available, reliable and actively maintained?
Is there a consolidated logging service available to applications that is reliable and supported?
Are all application logs pushed to the consolidated log service?
Does each application have a clear statement of what should be monitored, what performance metrics should be captured, how frequently and why?

Is there a monitoring & alerting strategy, covering:
- Infrastructure (network, storage)
- Servers
- Common infrastructure services
- Databases
- Application status/health
- Application performance
- Security
Is automated monitoring in place for Infrastructure (network, storage etc.)?
Is automated monitoring in place for Servers (CPU, RAM, disk space)?
Is automated monitoring in place for Common services (e.g. ELK, RabbitMQ)?
Is automated monitoring in place for Application status/health?
Notes: All depends on monitoring inside K8s. Would be good to get monitoring from the internet and AWS resource monitoring.

Question: Do alerts include actionable information?
Notes: Links to monitoring system but no runbooks or actions.

Question: Does a single Product Backlog exist for all types of work for the team?
Are backlog items written as user stories?
Can all stories be completed in less than a week?
Notes: Not all stories can be completed in a week

Question: Is there a product vision and roadmap that has been shared with the teams?
Notes: There is no one single source of truth

Question: Is there a full time dedicated Product Owner for the team?
Is there a Product Manager role within the business supporting the team?
Do business stakeholders understand agile principles and how to engage with the agile process?
Do the team understand who their direct and indirect customers are?
Are there clear channels where customers can and do provide feedback?
Is code instrumented to record usage analytics?
Is there an agreed Definition of Done?
Is the definition of done enforced during story sign-off?
Have expected quality metrics been defined?
Is there a quality heatmap showing systems rated against quality metrics?
Is quality seen as everybody's responsibility (or the role of testers)?
Have the team been trained on automated testing practices and tools?
Is Functional acceptance testing automation established?
Does all new code have automated functional acceptance tests?
Are there automated smoke tests for testing the correctness of an environment?
Are there E2E tests that certify the whole product runs correctly in a (copy of) production?
Is test coverage sufficient to give confidence that any significant problems introduced will lead to at least 1 test failure?
Is there a documented test data management process?
Is sanitised, representative test data used for the majority of non-production environments?
Is test data refreshed regularly and consistently across all environments?
Notes: Need to look into it when we have IGL in place

Question: Is there an integration testing environment?
Is the level of bugs/quality issues manageable and sustainable?
Do you have a documented Security Policy or standard?
Do you keep track a track record of security related stories and security bugs within the product?
When did you last perform a Security / Penetration test against your product?
What / Who is your point of contact regarding Security related  matters?
Do you have documented process to escalate security related incidents within the team and with other GfK teams?
Do you seek advise from GfK Group IT Security team on application security related matters? If so, how often?
Notes: JYLB is part of the design sessions

Question: Is source code managed in a modern source control system?
Is the branching strategy Trunk-based and able to supports multiple parallel development streams, regular integration, release stabilisation and hot-fixes without contention?
Are feature branches generally short-lived?
Are code changes checked-in at least daily?
Are check-in comments used consistently e.g. bug/task ID?
Is code built on dedicated and supported build servers?
Are binaries managed in a central binary repository?
Are binaries versioned with semantice versioning?
Notes: Image tag is used to differenciate the application deployed to various environments but libraries are semantic versioned

Question: Are binaries built once for deployment across multiple environments?
Does committing changes to a main branch automatically trigger a build?
Do unit tests run as part of the CI process with test failures preventing the build?
Do code quality checks run as part of the CI process, with failures preventing the build? ( score 3 complexity rules enforced?)
Do functional acceptance tests run as part of CI process?
Are there any coding standards/guides and are they used?
Are code reviews performed for all changes?
Are code reviews formalised? (e.g. checklist)
Do code reviews refer back to the story definition?
Do code reviews include reviewing the quality and coverage of unit tests?
Are code review issues captured and resolved?
Do all developers write automated unit tests?
Are unit tests created as part of bug fix process to automate regression testing?
Is technical debt tagged and tracked in JIRA
Is technical debt prioritised together with functional stories
Notes: Not at the moment as the team are cruising for MVP
